description: This course introduces a variety of documents (both literary and artistic) to investigate cultural
interactions between ancient Greece and the East in the first millennium BCE.  By studying the
mythological Trojan War, the Persian War, and Alexander the Great's decade of campaigns,
students consider how the ancient Greeks related to the alien cultures with which they were in
continual contact:  what did it mean to be "Greek" or "barbarian" in the ancient world?  Offered
periodically during Interim. Counts towards ancient studies major.
